tweets.text:
Hurrah! Boris has announced new nature targets to help dodge the imminent ecological crisis! 
Wait. 
That's because we completely bombed on the last set of goals, which we had a DECADE to meet and now wildlife is clinging on by the skin of its teeth
Let's take a closer look: 1/10

#Fish of the Severn Estuary are under threat. Thousands of fish will die in the double-decker sized cooling tunnels at Hinkley Point C. @EnvAgency @CefasGovUK @The_MMO please make the right decision and make sure an AFD is installed, as the DCO states. #SaveSevernsFish

tweets.text: My latest #PhD paper is now out! Assessing studded tiles as a tool for re-establishing river connectivity for river lamprey, and suggestions for future tile designs. 2/2 Arrangements are in place to transport boats offsite to a suitable boatyard. The footpath remains closed during this operation due to moving machinery. There will be a meeting for the boating community at 5.30pm at our incident vehicle.

Another project completed in the Isbourne catchment....this one consists of leaky Woody dams, attenuation areas and the use of an old mill pond. #nfm #slowtheflow #isbournecatch #flooding #naturalfloodmanagement @worcscc  @EnvAgencyMids @DefraGovUK https://t.co/D9HTSkyOQg

Targeted dredging has started on the River Steeping at #Wainfleet to remove silt from parts of the watercourse - the work is part of extensive plans drawn up in the wake of last year's #flooding. More info here: https://t.co/0xOqxHqZgB https://t.co/Up70uFxvUE

For @Feargal_Sharkey , no surprises here? Nitrate and Phosphate levels in Rivers Ver and Colne show river conditions as moderate or poor... not the ‚Äògood‚Äô the @EnvAgency predicted from 2015. Oh well... #chalkstream https://t.co/XtWGJusulB

@VerValleySoc @EnvAgencySE @Earthwatch_eur I gave it 5 days with no rain, time enough (youd think) for pure #chalkstream water to reach my location, half way down the Ver valley. Sadly, i didn‚Äôt find it reflected the ‚Äògood‚Äô status i was promised https://t.co/PglqvEswI4

tweets.text: Gonna need a bit of detective work on this one! "An angling club has gone bust in SE London along the Thames path, and a sectioned patch of water used by the club is full of dead and dying fish, probably due to poor aeration and a build-up of litter. Fish need help." RT'ing https://t.co/vat4uAE9Nx

We are currently arguing with the @EnvAgency about how they categorise and count sewage discharges. They are digging their heels in and now suggest damp ground is an acceptable reason to discharge sewage.
Great work team @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/YUC63zvH5n
